title: Peperonata Coddled Eggs
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
Slice the chilli, peel and finely slice 2 garlic cloves, and finely chop the basil stalks (reserve leaves).
Add frozen peppers, sliced onion, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes until softened.
Tear most basil leaves into the pan. Push peppers to one side and add tomatoes to the other. Break them up, mix into peppers, add a splash of vinegar, and cook for 10 minutes until thickened.
Make 4 wells in the sauce, crack in the eggs, season, cover, and cook on low heat until eggs are done (about 5 minutes for runny yolks).
Meanwhile, heat a griddle pan. Rub sourdough with the remaining garlic clove and char on both sides.
Serve peperonata and eggs on toast, crumble over feta, and scatter reserved basil leaves.
